table_of_contents.title:
Knowledge Graph Building Blocks: An
easy-to-use Framework for developing
FAIREr Knowledge Graphs

User story 1: Tom needs his data and metadata to be FAIR but does
not want to look at large, complex graphs

User story 2: Catherine and Felix want to add FAIR data to a
crowdsourced knowledge graph with a broad scope

User story 3: Sara and Bob do not know graph query languages and
struggle learning them

User story 4: Karl wants to enable users to intuitively make
statements about statements in a knowledge graph

User story 5: Dan and Anna describe the same type of measurement
data but use different community-specific data models

User story 6: John wants to change the database technology of the
backend of his biodiversity knowledge graph

User story 7: Mila wants to import semantically unstructured (legacy)
data from a tabular format into a FAIR knowledge graph

User story 8: Nick has to distinguish universal, prototypical, and
assertional statements in his knowledge graph

User story 9: Paula wants to build a FAIR knowledge graph, but has
neither experience in Semantics nor the required resources

Organizing a knowledge graph into different types of
semantic units

Representing different frames of reference and distinguishing the
ontological, diagnostic, and discursive layer in knowledge graphs
